section.p: The OtmMtEval tool is called from the DOS command line:
The filespec parameter specifies the input file(s) which can either be:

ul.li: the long name of an internal folder (e.g. "MyTestFolder")
the short name of an internal folder (e.g. "MYTES000.F00" )
the name (incl. path) of an external folder (e.g. "C:\MyTestFolders\MyTestFolder.FXP")
a generic name for a group of external folders (e.g. "C:\MyTestFolders\My*.FXP")
the name of a directory containing external folders (e.g. "C:\MyTestFolders)

section.p: If a directory is specified, the evaluation is performed for all external folders in the directory, and in all sub-directories of this directory.
The optional outfile parameter specifies the name of the output file. If no output file is specified C:\OtmMtEval.XML is used as default name.
The optional /details parameter activates the output of the segment detail information.
